title: ‘Abbey Road’ at 50: George Harrison, inscrutable lead guitarist with the Beatles who never felt comfortable with the attention brought by fame – obituary
text:
This obituary has been republished to mark 50 years since the release in the UK of the album Abbey Road by the Beatles.

George Harrison, who died on November 29 2001 aged 58, was the lead guitarist of the Beatles and one of the most important figures in popular music.

The youngest of the quartet, Harrison often felt his identity and input was overshadowed by the dominant personalities of John Lennon and Paul McCartney. By nature shy and a little vulnerable, he never felt comfortable with the attention fame brought, and of all the Beatles he strove the hardest to go his own way, both within the group and after its disintegration.

George Harrison was born at Wavertree, Liverpool, on February...
